Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PM15 (N-terminal GSKKPV deleted, thanatin analog, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a; XXA; BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (93.75%) toV16M thanatinR: 33%, C: 17%. GRAVY: -1.49; mol Wt: 1642.97.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 4 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 4 uM), S. enterica ATCC 14028 (MIC 4-8 uM), A-baumannii ATCC BAA-1798 (MIC >16 uM),  S.  pyogen ATCC 19615 (MIC 8 uM), and E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 8 uM).  Note that the peptide did not show activity in  in a new MH broth (Sigma-Millipore, St Louis, MO, USA).
Literature Information.Author: Abdullah SJ, Mu Y, Bhattacharjya S. 2024
Literature Information.Title: Structures, Interactions and Activity of the N-Terminal Truncated Variants of Antimicrobial Peptide Thanatin.
